intro: Tradescantia martensiana, commonly known as the red-veined nettle, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its striking red veins on its lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Tradescantia martensiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
